title: Marsh - Billings - Rockefeller National Historical Park: Park Home
body: Green Pastures and Green Mountains  Walk through one of Vermont's most beautiful landscapes, under the shade of sugar maples and 400-year-old hemlocks, across covered bridges and alongside rambling stone walls. This is a landscape of loss, recovery, and conservation. This is a story of stewardship, of people taking care of places - sharing an enduring connection to land and a sense of hope for the future. Read More             River Splash! Aug 13 11am-3pm Wilder VT   Family Fun in and out of the water at Kilowatt Park in Wilder VT. Try out a kayak, canoe or paddleboard with certified guides or enjoy games            Workshop for Educators Aug 19 10am-2pm   Explore all the Natl Park & Billings Farm & Museum have to offer with a  day of fun activities and programs - take one or more sessions!        Composing Wilderness Stephen Lias Aug 20   Join us at 4pm for "Composing Wilderness", an audio-visual presentation presented by composer Stephen Lias - Carriage Barn Visitor center              Founder's Day American Landscape artwork   Aug 25 6:30pm CELEBRATE 100th BIRTHDAY of the Natl Park Service hear an inspirational talk on art and the American conservation movement!        Centennial - 100th Anniversary Party!   Join us Aug 27 10am-4pm - 100th ANNIVERSARY CELEBRATION! Enjoy family games, children's art workshops, tours, Mansion walk-throughs...              Boots to Boats Adventures!   Celebrate the centennial with adventures in 2 amazing parks, 1 scenic trail and 1 beautiful river blueway!          Appalachian Trails & Tales Aug 20 9:30am   Hike on the iconic A.T. with the Green Mountain Club & enjoy activities, stories along the way. Dates: Aug 20; Sept 3, 17 Oct 1 - 9:30am            Forest Festival Weekend Sept 24-25    Take a horse-drawn wagon ride, enjoy hands-on activities, forest history, and woodworking demonstrations among the glory of fall foliage.
